intro: Campuleia rosea, commonly known as the pink spurge, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Euphorbiaceae family, characterized by its milky sap and showy inflorescences. The plant produces small, pinkish-white flowers clustered in umbrella-like structures called cyathia. Its leaves are alternate, simple, and have a slightly rough texture. Campuleia rosea thrives in full sun to partial shade and is often found in woodland edges and disturbed soils.
